section_a.beneficiaries: PE The company’s activities will provide benefit to ... The Aspiring Medic’s Support is an independent widening access project based in London that will support medical school applicants from socially disadvantaged backgrounds. Through various schemes, the project has served and will continue to benefit various members of the community including: - Young people aged 18-21 applying to medical school who have come from socially disadvantaged backgrounds (e.g. low income household or benefit payment dependent). Such members of the community will benefit from the extensive mentoring scheme of the project. - Parents of medical school applicants will also benefit from the project. This is because parents from lower socioeconomic classes are less likely to be well connected to the clinicians and health professionals that support their child’s application. The Aspiring Medic’s Support addresses this asymmetric information and closes the gap through closely working with the families of applicants. - School staff and younger students (11-16) will also benefit. The Aspiring Medic’s Support works closely to educate school staff on how to better support students. Widening access days will also educate and benefit younger students within the local community

section_a.beneficiaries: The Isle of Wight community encompasses a unique blend of local residents, artists, and artisans who navigate the island's geographical challenges of rurality and isolation. Its distinct character is shaped by its rich cultural heritage, which has been nurtured by its geographical seclusion. Despite its isolated location, the community thrives with a strong sense of resilience, creativity, and connection to the land. This community values its artistic and cultural traditions, cherishing opportunities to celebrate and showcase local talent. The company aims to benefit this community by supporting its artistic endeavours, fostering collaboration, and enhancing cultura! engagement, thereby preserving and promoting the Isle of Wight's rich cultural heritage while addressing its unique geographical challenges. The company’s activities will provide benefit to the residents of the Isle of Wight, with a particular focus on local artists, artisans, and the wider community interested in arts, crafts, and culture

Our mission is to connect children with nature by helping schools make the most of their outdoor spaces so the primary beneficiaries will be the schools’ children who will develop their learning and understanding of the natural world, building life skills and improving their mental and physical wellbeing. The programme will build a network of Lambeth schools to share learning and information, support each other's initiatives and benefit from the impact that a wider alliance brings.
